channel.title: Alpha?
channel.description:
@MITB: do you care if i purchase a cheap VPS and give access to the devs, and we host the current build and allow people to play and pick up bugs? people can report anything that's missing and we'll get some people to attempt to crash the server in any way they can, to get it as stable as possible?
i have a little bit of free time ahead of me and looking to improve this server.

item.title: Alpha?
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:18, topic:418230”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=520775.msg3803240#msg3803240 date=1320234777]

One step closer to alpha, I just got this all set up:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/MoparClassic/

It checks github for new commits every hour, and when it finds a new commit, it automatically compiles it (with the ant script) and archives the results.

Can someone post some instructions so someone who knows absolutely nothing about RSC can set up a server? Preferably in the README on github, alternatively here, and I can post it on github. Then I can work on getting up a VPS to run it in.
[/quote]You should just create an issue on GitHub next time.

I’ve quoted the relevant portion of your post and made an issue.

Not very many people have commit access to github, so I figured they might want to just post instructions here. Anyone want to do that?[/quote]They just need to fork it and submit a pull request.

Read full topic

One step closer to alpha, I just got this all set up:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/jenkins/job/MoparClassic/

It checks github for new commits every hour, and when it finds a new commit, it automatically compiles it (with the ant script) and archives the results.

Can someone post some instructions so someone who knows absolutely nothing about RSC can set up a server? Preferably in the README on github, alternatively here, and I can post it on github. Then I can work on getting up a VPS to run it in.
[/quote]You should just create an issue on GitHub next time.

I’ve quoted the relevant portion of your post and made an issue.[/quote]

Not very many people have commit access to github, so I figured they might want to just post instructions here. Anyone want to do that?

Read full topic

item.title: Alpha?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Before I started hosting it, I was going to set it up so jenkins automatically builds it and deploys it to the server, that way changes are quick and automatic, at least during the alpha/beta. (probably not in production, security risk)

If you want me to start hosting it though, why don’t one of you work on finishing up getting the client to work in MoparScape 4? CodeForFame did 99% of the work required, it just has to be made to not ask for 2 or 3 permissions and it should work.

edit:
Just got OpenVZ running on my home server, I can now do the same to my main server and create a VPS to run the server from.

Read full topic

ill look at getting it up this weekend. will host the client at rapidshare/megaupload or something.
